page.title: 11Destratification
page.content:
RESERVOIR DESTRATIFICATION
Reservoirs undergo stratification during the summer months which is caused by a warm zone of water floaing on a colder, more dense zone of water in the body of the reservoir.Natural mixing is prevented by the formation of thermocline, a region of rapid change of temperature with depth. In a stratified reservoir there are three distinct layers: Epilimnion - Upper layer of warm water. Thermocline - Region of rapid change of temperature with depth Hypolimnion - Low layer of cold and dense water.
